recommendations: Chaine Leaps is a series of jumps in which the skater alternates between the front and back legs.. For practicing Chaine Leaps as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Chaine turn combinations, Saute arabesque, Saute attitude for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Begin in B-plus position., Perform a chaine turn, swinging arms., Push off the back leg, leaping with straight legs., Land on the front leg, bending knees., Continue leaping with alternating legs. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on coordination, additional exercises could include Pirouette with arms, Spotting practice, Quick footwork patterns.

Chaine Leaps is a series of jumps in which the skater alternates between the front and back legs.. For practicing Chaine Leaps as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Chaine turns, Skips, Leap preparations for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Perform a chaine turn., Push off the back leg, leaping forward., Land on the front leg, bending knees., Repeat with the opposite leg. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on coordination, additional exercises could include Pirouette with arms, Spotting practice, Quick footwork patterns.

Hitch Kick is a jump in which the skater kicks the back leg forward, then lands on the front foot.. For practicing Hitch Kick as a/an advanced performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Leg swings with turnout, Jumping lunges, Plyometric single-leg hops for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Kick leading leg forward, knee straight and high., Hop on supporting leg, bending knee., Kick trailing leg forward, knee straight and high., Land on trailing leg, leading leg in front, maintaining balance. for 10 repetitions for 20 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on coordination, additional exercises could include Pirouette with arms, Spotting practice, Quick footwork patterns.
